newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony says still discussing its JSkyB stake.
newsitem.headline: Sony says still discussing its JSkyB stake.

text.p: Sony Corp said on Tuesday it has not yet reached agreement with Softbank Corp and News Corp on its share in their satellite broadcasting venture Japan Sky Broadcasting (JSkyB).
"We have been requesting a certain stake in the firm so that Sony will have a say in the firm's management. But an agreement has yet to be reached," said the spokesman.
A Softbank spokesman said earlier on Tuesday that the venture would be owned equally by Sony, Softbank and News Corp.
JSkyB is scheduled to start beaming 12 channels into Japan in April, and plans to increase that number to 150 channels by April 1998.

A Softbank spokesman said earlier that the three were considering Sony's capital participation in the venture as well as a possible role for it in providing audiovisual software and broadcasting equipment.
